name: Rooftop Laundry Service - Cafe & Bar
address: 84 Ngo Duc Ke, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Cozy rooftop Laundry, with cafe & bar service. Chill on the rooftop while getting your laundry done.
example_reviews: This rooftop laundry shop in District 1, right across from Bitexco Tower, is a hidden gem. It’s a simple but smart idea — do your laundry while enjoying a great cup of coffee and a beautiful city view. The prices are fair, and the staff are friendly and welcoming. The coffee is smooth and delicious, whether you like it strong or creamy. It’s more than just a place to wash clothes — it turns a boring chore into a relaxing experience. If you’re in the area, it’s definitely worth a visit.

We are arround around and finally find this Self Service Laundry on the rooftop While waiting we have salt coffee, egg coffee, and it excellent! Price for laundry very good price The only thing you have to go to the rooftop to do it, but it is the central of the City.
Laundry cafe make every visit pleasant, and it’s clear they care about their customers.thanks to its prime location in the bustling Ngo Duc Ke area.

name: Bếp Mẹ ỉn
address: 136/9 Đường Lê Thánh Tôn, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: It is all about Vietnamese food. Lovely staff and at such a beautiful place reminding Vietnam at its 1975 as the pearl of South East Asia. Tasting Mama's In food and surrounded with windows and scenes of simple Vietnamese and stuff make the delicious food even more delicious.
example_reviews: Traditional looking restaurant in a courtyard of restaurants and cafés up an alleyway opposite the Ben Than Market ( north side - Le Thanh Ton Street) and claiming to (and probably is) serving home cooking style meals. Varied though complicated menu - specialist noodle dishes (on a separate menu) are brought in from the place next door - complicate things if you want to pay by credit card. (No fee if you pay by credit card just for food and drink off the restaurants own menu.). Very tasty food, prompt and helpful service. We sat downstairs on long tables, so other diners next to us, as the upstairs seemed airless - without a balcony or window. Breath of salad range and vegetarian options seem limited. Some dishes, like snakehead fish we have not seen elsewhere. Good value – means 100-240k approx, sides about 30k. We spent about 450k between the two of us.

This restaurant was recommended by our guide when we first arrived in Saigon. We went there on our first evening, and then back again for lunch on our final day. It is situated down a narrow alleyway but we found it easily with the instructions given by our guide. (He mentioned that this was his 'go to' restaurant when he was going for a meal with friends.) The restaurant is small and you will generally have to share one of the long tables with other people. You may also need to wait to be seated, though on both occasions the wait was no more than ten minutes (after initially being told that it could be half an hour). However, it is worth it as the food is very good, albeit a bit more expensive than in some other establishments. (And note that the menu price does not include tax which adds 8% to the bill.)

Located down a small street near Ben Thanh Market in Ho Chi Minh City, Bếp Mẹ Ỉn (which translates to “Mom’s Kitchen”) is a hidden gem. Here’s why you should consider dining here: Tasty Vietnamese Flavors: Bếp Mẹ Ỉn serves up authentic Vietnamese cuisine that bursts with flavor. From deep-fried tofu with impeccably crispy exteriors to succulent grilled chicken legs, your taste buds are in for a treat. Fantastic Price Value: If you’re looking for a budget-friendly meal without compromising on quality, this is the place. Bếp Mẹ Ỉn offers a wide variety of dishes at wallet-friendly prices. Friendly Staff: The staff here are warm, friendly, and attentive. Whether you’re a local or a traveler, they’ll make you feel right at home. Refreshing Drinks and Desserts: Pair your meal with interesting and refreshing drinks. And don’t forget to explore their dessert options—they’re delightful! Pro Tip: Try the Grilled Chicken Leg with Chilli Salt and thank me later! Remember, this review is based on available sources, so if you get a chance to visit Bếp Mẹ Ỉn yourself, share your personal experience with others!

name: Truffle Restaurant
address: 208 Nguyen Huu Canh Level 73, Vincom Landmark 81, Vinhomes Central Park, Ward 22, Binh Thanh, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Truffle Restaurant in Landmark 81 offers an exquisite dining experience overlooking the beautiful skyline of Ho Chi Minh City. The restaurant serves set menus with a focus on French cuisine, using the freshest and highest-quality ingredients. The relaxed and elegant atmosphere, accompanied by knowledgeable and attentive staff, ensures a memorable dining experience. The menu also features a selection of fine wines and spirits to complement the delicious meal. For those seeking a luxurious and indulgent dining experience, Truffle Restaurant in Landmark 81 is definitely worth a visit.
example_reviews: The overall experience was wonderful! It makes the price seem cheap compared to the excellent quality of service and food here! The staffs are all really nice and they make your dininng time feel heartwarm. In particular, Alex was hearty in showing the way, Kayla is an excellent bartender who caters for her guests in a very active, friendly way. I am also especially impressed at Francis for his food knowledge, his friendliness and engagement when serving his customers. As for the food, gotta say Chef Pierrick has both a great sense of arts and excellent cooking level! Our food was both gorgeous to look at and exquisite to dine! Totally deserving of the Michelin stars he got! Made our anniversary an unforgettable memory!

The view and amazing service captivated me, not to mention the stellar, well thought out dishes. A perfect combination of elegance, atmosphere, and thought provoking food created an amazing experience. will come again

Good food; nice staff and a really nice view over Saigon. The restaurant to get away from the traffic and in a distance really enjoy the atmosphere of the town. If you’re planning to eat it could be a good idea to book a seat the evening before, , but cozy.The view is great, the staff are super friendly and the food is delicious! Highly recommend!

name: Cloud Nine Sai Gon Restaurant
address: 180 -188 Ly Tu Trong Street 11th Floor, La Siesta Premium Saigon Hotel, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: A chic and intimate space living up to its name. This is one of the best spots in Sai Gon to enjoy drinks as the sun sets over Park and Ben Thanh Market. Offering 270-degree city views, the environment created is the best of all worlds. “Luxuriously high enough up to delight in exquisitely romantic views of Park in its entirety, yet close enough to feel at eye level and at one with the city streets and rooftops. Beautifully and atmospherically designed – glass, metal and wood complement a monochromatic color palate of black, granite grey and hints of cream. Background chill-out music creates a trendy understated vibe. The overall effect is one of charming elegance.” The Twilight Bar is La Siesta Premium pièce de résistance – with an extensive range of international wines, signature cocktails, beers and spirits a well as an exciting menu of non-alcoholic beverages.
example_reviews: Saigon has countless restaurants on high floors, but from this one you not only have great views, but also a culinary experience of the highest standard. The truffle mushroom soup was a poem, the fish each exquisite and refined and the service beyond any doubt. We have been to one of the “sister restaurants” in Hoi An twice before and were fully enthusiastic here as well. Prices are slightly higher for the country level, of course, but in all Western countries you would probably pay double for dinner at this level. Accordingly, a fair deal for visitors to the city with high standards of cuisine.

Cloud Nine is a real rare gem! Upon arrival, we were greeted with elegance and great courtesy. The service is impeccable, attentive without being intrusive. Each dish was a work of art, combining creativity, finesse and exquisite flavours. The atmosphere of the restaurant is simply mesmerizing: dim light, soft music, and a refined decoration that invites relaxation. Perfect for a romantic dinner or a special occasion. We spent a moment suspended out of time. An unmissable address for lovers of fine dining!

We came here for our last dinner before leaving Vietnam after a 3 week trip. We chose from the a la carte, their spring rolls were the best we’ve had and we were recommended the fillet steaks which were flamboyantly finished off by our table with flames. We have eaten Vietnamese every day of our holiday so far but although a western dish it had a Vietnamese twist. Staff were attentive and friendly. Views spectacular. Highly recommended for a special meal.

name: Secret Garden Vietnamese Restaurant
address: 19 Le Cong Kieu Street, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Warmly welcome you to the newly renovated Secret Garden 2nd Branch - Vietnamese Restaurant. A prime location just 2 mins walk from Bến Thành Market & MRT Bến Thành. It's design a tribute to the timeless beauty of Vietnam’s Northwest highlands. The crafted rustic bricks roof, the wooden pillars, the soil & mud textured walls carry the ancient of village homes. Surrounding it all, a lush tropical garden thrives, vibrant & alive.
example_reviews: The rustic decor, from soil-textured walls to lush greenery, transported us to Vietnam’s highlands. We lingered over tender shaking beef and tangy green mango salads, paired with icy sugarcane juice. The proximity to Ben Thanh Market added convenience, but the tranquil vibe made it feel worlds away. Perfect for a romantic escape amid Ho Chi Minh’s chaos.

Shopping with my husband in Ho Chi Minh City, I stumbled upon this treasure restaurant! The environment is really great, surrounded by greenery and it feels like a holiday. The dishes are authentic Vietnamese home-cooked, delicious and reasonably priced. It is very close to the market and subway station. Perfect for couples to come here for food and romantic time!

What a find! Calm relaxing atmosphere, excellent unobtrusive service, and the food was wonderful. Great flavours and textures. Can recommend the squid with salt and chilli, and the mango salad with fish. Prices very reasonably A hidden gem. Recommended

name: Cuc Gach Quan
address: 10 Dang Tat Ward Tan Dinh, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description:
Recommended by a friend, I ate here. I ate here again after a short trip. It is definitely one of the most cost-effective Vietnamese dishes for middle-class people traveling to hcmc!

The price is cost-effective. One dish is only 100-200k vnd. Two people ordered 4 dishes and each person was about 100 yuan. But the drinks are relatively expensive!

Salad recommendation: Pomelo seafood salad. Very appetizing! The sour and spicy taste is suitable for Cantonese people!
Fried tofu. The skin is fried crispy, but the bean and egg flavor is not enough inside.
As for the soup, the base is sweet and sour. It is quite delicious with Catfish (but it is more oily)

If you want me to recommend a restaurant to hcmc, I will immediately recommend this one and only this one!
example_reviews: Recommended by a friend, I ate here. I ate here again after a short trip. It is definitely one of the most cost-effective Vietnamese dishes for middle-class people traveling to hcmc! The price is cost-effective. One dish is only 100-200k vnd. Two people ordered 4 dishes and each person was about 100 yuan. But the drinks are relatively expensive! Salad recommendation: Pomelo seafood salad. Very appetizing! The sour and spicy taste is suitable for Cantonese people! Fried tofu. The skin is fried crispy, but the bean and egg flavor is not enough inside. As for the soup, the base is sweet and sour. It is quite delicious with Catfish (but it is more oily) If you want me to recommend a restaurant to hcmc, I will immediately recommend this one and only this one!

We had an amazing dinner at the unique Vietnamese restaurant - based on home cooked food and occupying two homes across the street from each other. You are escorted upstairs to the table and a sumptuous feast followed - in fact a little too much. One specialty is deep fried tofu which we had been told about but to our tastes it was still like tasteless tofu, sadly. The remainder of the meal was excellent however and the service first rate, the ambience was very attractive and we would recommend this restaurant. It is a bit of a way off the main Saigon CBD so you will need transport, we had it all pre-booked. There is a modest wine list and the meal washed down with a good white wine was very enjoyable.

The feel was superb from beginning to end. We’ve been traveling around Vietnam for 2 weeks and this was by far our favorite meal. We ordered an ungodly amount of food because we just couldn’t decide what to pick. My number one choice was the soft shell crab recommended by our waitress. We also loved the ginger chicken, the shrimp and bacon (more like pork belly)(incredible), papaya salad, pomelo salad with shrimp and pork, spring rolls, coconut smoothie, orange smoothie, Tom Collins cocktail, Good Morning Vietnam cocktail (the only thing that didn’t wow me), the fruit platter for dessert, and the herbal jelly. Every bite is flavorful and well presented. The building is interesting and homey. The service was great and the food came out quickly. We loved it! Thanks for a great dinner!

name: Shri Lifestyle Dining
address: 72-74 Nguyen Thi Minh Khai 23rd Floor Centec Tower, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Shri Restaurant & Lounge has a casual outdoor garden terrace, a stylish non-smoking dining room and and an indoor glass house terrace, all with an outstanding view of the city. We also have a large comfortable lounge perfect for enjoying cocktails before or after dinner. Shri is well suited for everything from business lunch or dinners, romantic nights out & special occasions as well as our sunset happy hour for drinks from 15:00 to 19:00.
example_reviews: They have stunning view over looking Ho Chi Minh City. Great terrace table at nice for dinner. Great tapas menu good for sharing and amazing cocktail list that I think is extremly creative.

The welcome is good as staff guide you up to the restaurant, but the atmosphere when you get there is underwhelming. The eating area is next to the bar. The food was well cooked and tasty and the price feels right.

I chose this restaurant because one of my Saigonese friends recommended it after knowing that I was looking for a nice place with city view to have dinner with my friend in the centre. And I would love to recommend it as well now. There are inside and outside parts. I had an outdoor table near the glass wall then I was enjoying great city view while tasting delicious food. Tasty dishes, good drinks, fresh air! Love it!

name: Charm Bakery
address: Số 10 Lê Thị Riêng Ben Thanh Ward , District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to our Banh Mi shop & drinks We have many types of sandwiches : roast pork , bbq , roast chicken , eggs , vegetarian , pate & hams ... many fresh juice ( mango , avocado ... coffee , soft drink...)
example_reviews: We spontaneously ate a Banh Mi here for lunch when we were actually looking for another Banh Mi shop. The baguettes are very good and don't have liver pate on them, which was nice after all these days. The chicken was cut into slices and therefore not so dry and the vegetables were fresh. The Banh Mi here aren't exactly cheap though. One costs between 60,000 and 80,000 dong. The service was very friendly and we also got a free friendship bracelet that is supposed to bring us luck.

These were the first bahn mi of this trip and they did not disappoint the bread was fresh and crispy and the filling’s plentiful, I had roast pork and hubby had the special, we also had a coke and a mango smoothie which was so refreshing, all this for 190000 dong, being given the beautiful charm bracelet at the end is very special and a lovely momento of our trip. The lady who served us was so lovely. Tip- on the back of the menu they have things like how much chilli, coriander or no coriander and many more options so it makes ordering so easy.

Banh Mi very good and very rich! The ingredients are all fresh. Prices more than fair for sitting with air conditioning and soft drinks. The staff is very nice, it also says that if you don’t like Banh Mi at first bite you can say it and change it without problems.

name: Phở Việt Nam - Phạm Hồng Thái
address: 14 Pham Hong Thai Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Great food! Loved the pho. I had the beef and tendon pho. They have large portions for a great price and there are plenty of condiments. I also had the egg soup. The pho was great but I’ve never really had a bad pho since I have been here. For foreigners the pho is a bargain but compared to other places it is slightly more expensive. It’s a great place to chill inside and the customer service was amazing. It’s a Michelin star restaurant so totally recommend checking this out. I’ve had heaps of pho and personally I like stopping into family owned shops with the locals. I wouldn’t pass this by whilst you are in HCM so have a try!
review_summary:
Phở Việt Nam - Phạm Hồng Thái receives accolades for its authentic pho, which guests have called out for its rich flavors and freshly made noodles. Nestled in the convenient location of district 1, the restaurant offers a warm and inviting atmosphere that many find enhances their dining experience.

The swift and amiable service contributes to the positive reviews, while the exceptional value for generous portions of delicious, authentic meals is consistently praised by patrons.
example_reviews: Great food! Loved the pho. I had the beef and tendon pho. They have large portions for a great price and there are plenty of condiments. I also had the egg soup. The pho was great but I’ve never really had a bad pho since I have been here. For foreigners the pho is a bargain but compared to other places it is slightly more expensive. It’s a great place to chill inside and the customer service was amazing. It’s a Michelin star restaurant so totally recommend checking this out. I’ve had heaps of pho and personally I like stopping into family owned shops with the locals. I wouldn’t pass this by whilst you are in HCM so have a try!

Phở Việt Nam - Phạm Hồng Thái is a popular spot in Ho Chi Minh City, known for its rich, flavorful broth and fresh, house-made noodles. Their phở thố đá (served in a hot stone bowl) keeps the soup warm till the last bite. With fast service and a clean, bustling atmosphere, it’s a great choice for authentic Vietnamese phở. Michelin Guide-approved!

Whow what an amazing restaurant & soo cheap. We had their best seller in the sizzling pho, the staff were super friendly and showed us how to make the sauces to go with it. The herbs ect to accompany the dish were fresh and well presented. There was heaps of beef in the soup and they make their noodles fresh onsite. It was busy, we weren’t rushed, it was clean, but mostly the food was soo delicious. We had a great experience here and if we had more time would have gone back. So worth finding this restaurant to have their Michelin Star Pho. Thank you for an enjoyable meal.

name: Banana Mama Rooftop & Kitchen
address: 102 ABC Cong Quynh WMC TOWER - 10th Floor, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: We love rooftops and found this place after visiting another rooftop nearby. We were impressed with modern and fun vibes, DJ set created great atmosphere, team was proactive and helpful with finding place to sit and fast to take our order. We wanted to try Smashed Burgers as we red good feedback about them and OMG they were so good we came back second time for them! Softest buns on earth, meat so juicy and smokey grilled, even gherkin so tasty- pure joy for burger lovers! Wish we had more days in Ho Chi Minh to try other burgers. Really great job!
example_reviews: We love rooftops and found this place after visiting another rooftop nearby. We were impressed with modern and fun vibes, DJ set created great atmosphere, team was proactive and helpful with finding place to sit and fast to take our order. We wanted to try Smashed Burgers as we red good feedback about them and OMG they were so good we came back second time for them! Softest buns on earth, meat so juicy and smokey grilled, even gherkin so tasty- pure joy for burger lovers! Wish we had more days in Ho Chi Minh to try other burgers. Really great job!

You shouldn't actually write a review so that it remains an insider tip, but this bar has to be reviewed. The location is in the south center of Saigon and we would always (again) take a taxi to and from the bar in the evening. There is a security guard in front of the apartment building (who also hails a taxi) and only a relatively small sign points to the bar, which you then reach by elevator from the lobby. And then? Wow, good music from various DJs (maybe a bit too loud, you still want to talk), nice people and good drinks of all kinds. We had a few drinks with friends, cocktails, draft beer, soft drinks and juices, everything was great. We were there for many hours and more than enjoyed it! The hamburgers are particularly worth mentioning and outstanding. You should be careful with superlatives, but these hamburgers are really world class! In addition, you sit or dance on a roof terrace with a great view of Saigon, the service is very friendly and quick and everything is affordable. You should definitely go! Crystal clear recommendation!

Awesome vibes, excellent service, friendly vibe and top notch management. Emily will teach you card games, and has fantastic drink recommendations. The staff kept me company while I waited for my friends, ask them about the burgers, the menus, the after parties 🎉 Highly recommended.

name: Social Club Rooftop Bar
address: 76-78 Nguyen Thi Minh Khai Street, District 3 23rd Floor, Hotel des Arts Saigon, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Perched on the 24th floor of Hôtel des Arts Saigon, The Social Club Rooftop Bar offers breathtaking sunset views above the Saigon skyline. Guests can indulge in a selection of handcrafted cocktails, a refined wine list, and delectable food bites, all while relaxing by the infinity pool. The vibrant atmosphere is enhanced by live DJ sets. The perfect spot to unwind, socialize, and enjoy the stunning cityscape.
example_reviews: We always aim for a Sunday Brunch in our travels. We were staying at the hotel so booked into the brunch here. Upon arrival we were met by an enthusiastic staff member who showed us to our table. Our brunch included free flow drinks. There was a choice of four cocktails but I asked if it was possible to have another one and it was not a problem. The beer and wine were cold and readily available if you wished. The food was great - oysters, crab, prawns, lobster, lamb, beef, fish, sushi, salads, dessert, cheeses - and the list goes on. It was an excellent choice of food and no shortage. The two staff members who looked after us were fabulous. They were friendly and attentive. It is a great people watching venue. There was a real mixture of people - resident expats in groups, local couples enjoying a day out, groups of friends, mixed ages but all enjoying the afternoon. There was a DJ who played a good range of music. The only thing we didn't like was guys wearing singlets and flip flops. This is a fine dining restaurant. If there is one thing the hotel can do, it is to set and maintain a minimum standard and this should apply to dress. Apart from that, the brunch is worth a shot.

I went here for dinner by myself and Lan Linh F&B server was sooo friendly and supportive taking so many beautiful photos for me as I was here by myself to enjoy. I enjoyed the dinner and the pretty photos of me that she took for me I’m very happy. Thanks Linh! I’ll be back again.

I visited the social club on 6 Nov for my late dinner. An energetic young man Nhan Bui greeted me with a big smile and addressed me to a window seat with a very nice view. He is not only very knowledgeable on what they can offer and also have the patience to identify what s the best solution/food which I might need. What I observed is that he is a very hard working staff, he always serve and clean my table at the right time. I believe it required a very good attention on the customers. Every step he made can let you to feel his passion on serving customers. Overall, food quality met the expectation while the services far exceed. Special thanks to him and his team mates for their kind and responsive services. And most of your team members can speak fluent English. It is really a distinguished competitive edge in the market. 11月6日，我参观了社交俱乐部，吃了一顿很晚的晚餐。一个精力充沛的年轻人Nhan Bui微笑着迎接我，并把我对着一个可以看到美景的靠窗座位。他不仅非常了解他们可以提供什么，而且有耐心确定我可能需要的最佳解决方案/食物。我观察到的是，他是一个非常勤奋的员工，他总是在正确的时间服务和打扫我的桌子。我相信这需要非常关注客户。他迈出的每一步都能让你感受到他对为客户服务的热情。 总体而言，食品质量达到了预期，而服务远远超过预期。特别感谢他和他的队友们的友好和反应灵敏的服务。你的大多数团队成员都能说一口流利的英语。这确实是市场上一个突出的竞争优势。 强烈推荐。

name: Café Marcel
address: 28 Ngo Quang Huy, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Breakfast & Brunch All-Day in Thao Dien. At Café Marcel, we do everything ourselves, from scratch. Chef Brian Chu selects only the best products, sourced locally from trusted suppliers. Homemade and fresh, that’s how we like it at Café Marcel.
example_reviews: Today I went to meet a friend at Cafe Marcel. Stepping from a busy street I was instantly greeted by friendly staff and a relaxing environment. As it was my first time going there, the server politely explained both the food and drink menu and allowed me time to make my choices. I was promptly given my drink and without being rushed given a generous plate of food. The house made sausages had the perfect level of spice and my eggs were perfect for dipping the crunchy sourdough toast. All in all I can not recommend this place enough. Great addition to Saigon if you’re looking for a meeting point or delicious, fresh breakfast!

Amazing breakfast!!! The first time we went we were served by giang and the second time by phuong both were really lovely and helpful explaining the breakfast menu which is great value by the way. You can choose your eggs then your bread and sauce etc, they also have a really good brunch deal. The portions were really big and the food and iced coffee was so so good, would highly reccommend!

This little cafe popped up in the search when we were looking for a flavorful meal on our last day in HCMC and it didn't disappoint. This is a tiny little cafe with seating on the first floor. Interiors are beautifully done and the staff is very courteous. Food items we had were Spicy Shakshuka, avocado tartine & iced phin coffee. Shakshuka wasn't very spicy, just the right amount for beautiful flavors. Avocado tartine was full of fresh avocado mash and cheese. And the coffee was just the right companion to top the entire meal. I would say it's the perfect place for breakfast/brunch. Prices are a little high as compared to other food options in the vicinity - but absolutely worth it...

name: Tung's Restaurant
address: 230 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn Phường Bến Thành, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Tung's Restaurant - Vietnamese Cuisine & vegetarian Food, a premier Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Saigon. Celebrated for our authentic Vietnamese cuisine, we offer a diverse menu that highlights the rich flavors of Northern Vietnam. At Tung's, we cater to all tastes with our extensive restaurant food selection, featuring hearty breakfast options, delicious lunch and dinner plates, and a variety of selectable vegetarian dishes. As a top choice among vegetarian restaurants, we delight both vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. Experience the aromatic and intricate tastes of Vietnamese food at Tung's, where every dish is crafted to perfection. Join us for a memorable culinary journey that brings the essence of Northern Vietnamese cuisine to your table.
example_reviews: Try raw egg coffee for the first time and it's mellow. Beef rolls are also delicious, and it's the first time you've tried this way. The service like 💕SIM is warm, speaks Chinese and English, and introduces the culture and hanging pictures of the restaurant. Overall, the restaurant's environment is also comfortable, full of Vietnamese flair and attentive to the needs of each guest.

We were welcome warmly by the staff and the atmosphere was lovely! Our server Dom recommended some excellent veggie dishes and I would highly recommend the Tofu in Tomato sauce! The staff were very friendly and attentive and demonstrated how to create the bun cha rolls!

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Highly recommended! 🍽️ Food – 5 stars We ordered European dishes and were served exactly as we wanted. The food was excellent, taste top and the portions just right. A special surprise was the clear vegetable soup we got unsolicited – a very nice gesture that reinforced the positive impression. 👨‍🍳 Service – 5 stars The service was exemplary! Our waiter from the team was extremely attentive and spoke very good English. Particularly positive: Not only did he give us expert recommendations, but he also repeated the order to make sure everything fits. That's what you'd like! 🧼 Cleanliness – 5 stars The restaurant was spotlessly clean – both the floor and tables were in perfect condition. Here you can see that great importance is attached to hygiene. 🚻 Toilets – 5 stars The toilets were modern and also extremely clean. This also speaks to the quality of this restaurant. ⭐⭐⭐⭐ Conclusion An absolute recommendation for everyone who is traveling in this city! Those who value good food, excellent service and cleanliness should definitely stop by here – it’s worth it! 💯

name: Little HaNoi Egg Coffee
address: 119/5 Yersin Phuong Phạm Ngu Lao, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: A stunning cafe tucked away down a side street serving the best food and coffee with a great menu choice. Everything looked SO good. You get a little pot of banana and watermelon and cinnamon tea for free which is a nice touch and great if you like finishing a meal on something sweet. The staff were so lovely and kind too! There were postcards you could take home as a little keepsake (make a donation to charity). Would highly recommend here for brunch with friends/partner/solo.
example_reviews: A stunning cafe tucked away down a side street serving the best food and coffee with a great menu choice. Everything looked SO good. You get a little pot of banana and watermelon and cinnamon tea for free which is a nice touch and great if you like finishing a meal on something sweet. The staff were so lovely and kind too! There were postcards you could take home as a little keepsake (make a donation to charity). Would highly recommend here for brunch with friends/partner/solo.

This is the perfect coffee shop! Came here unexpectedly while walking the streets and couldn’t be more happy we found it. They welcomed us with a lovely refreshing glass of cinnamon tea, kindly appreciated. We ordered egg coffee, Vietnamese coffee, tuna sandwich and mango with yoghurt. It was all amazing, the egg coffee was the best I’ve had by far, if you want to try it or love it already, you have to come here! The Vietnamese coffee was also excellent. The tuna sandwich was delicious and hearty, and came with a complimentary fruit pot. The mango yoghurt was so sweet and flavourful. All in all, amazing food and drinks! Nhien was such a lovely waitress, so kind and welcoming. There’s a nice view of the street, and upstairs is cosy and quiet. A perfect escape from the busy streets, with such a calm, lovely vibe. We could not recommend it enough here.

I have been coming to HCMC for many years and Little HaNoi Egg Coffee restaurants are some of my favorite places to eat. There are a number of them and they all serve great food in a pleasant environment. Previously, my favorite was avocado egg toast, but since they added eggs benedict that has been my go to favorite. They have a whole page of different versions. I, of course, pair it with egg coffee. Potato wedges are optional and make a nice addition.

name: Palsaik Korean Bbq Vietnam - Đông Du
address: 68-70 Đông Du Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Palsaik Korean BBQ là thương hiệu được thành lập từ năm 2007, có nguồn gốc từ Hàn Quốc đã đạt được sự ca ngợi quốc tế với hơn 100 địa điểm trên toàn thế giới. Được biết đến với cách tiếp cận sáng tạo, nhà hàng cung cấp tám hương vị thịt ba chỉ ướp khác biệt, nâng cao trải nghiệm BBQ truyền thống của Hàn Quốc.
example_reviews: Ask for Jenny! Never been to Korean BBQ. Thought we would give it a go. Wonderful experience. We ordered the meal servicing 4-6 people, it would have easily fed 6. Great selection of vegetables, pork and beef cooked at your table. The meal came with a selection of sauces, quail eggs, broccoli, zucchini and other side dishes. This was followed with a delicious sweet and sour soup with beef and mushrooms. Food was fresh and delicious. Very reasonable priced. Wonderful service and experience.

We had dinner here twice and the service was always lovely. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Food was amazing. We ordered some recommended sets which were delicious and covered meat together with soup and grilled vegies. Highly recommended!

We had never eaten Korean and this restaurant was recommended by the guide. Never regretted a moment. Yumi, our host made a delicious meal for us and made sure we felt comfortable. Absolutely recommended!

name: Laang Restaurant
address: 22 Dang Huu Pho Thao Dien, District 2, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Laang is an Asian-inspired, vegetarian-friendly restaurant in Saigon. We provide progressive urbanites an all-day healthy dining experience using fresh ingredients sourced locally. We want to build a lifestyle and a brand that emphasize on high-quality, advocates for local ingredients and celebrates authentic human connection.
example_reviews: We found this restaurant on trip advisor and we're able to get a table on fairly short notice. The menu is some 60 pages long. We chose three chef special items to share and it was plenty of food for two. We also ordered two desserts. The presentation is impressive and everything tasted good. Prices are quite reasonable.

My friends from the US were visiting Saigon for the first time - as they are vegetarian with sensitive stomachs and extremely wary of the tap water in Vietnam, I knew I had to bring them to this hidden gem in Thao Dien. In addition to the amazing and relaxing ambience, Laang has a great vegetarian option on its extensive menu. We ordered several dishes off the menu, including the stewed king oyster mushroom, grilled eggplant stuffed with shitake mushrooms, and stir-fried flat noodles with mixed mushrooms. Everything was delicious and my friends were very happy with the food. The pricing is extremely reasonable (6-15 USD / dish) given the ambience and service. If you visit, be sure to ask for Lukas who is the GM and he'll be sure to take care of you. He has deep experience working in F&B and originally worked in a Michelin rated restaurant in Europe. He's extremely knowledgeable about wines so can provide great recommendations if you're a newbie like me. Overall great restaurant with great service and great people. Couldn't recommend more highly.

Nice restaurant with romance view, nice food and perfect service. I got 110% support from staff to setup a dinner for 19 people, 1 of our guest need to use Halal food and restaurant could support me to bringing the Halal food which delivered from another restaurant. I need to deposit 6 M VND for our dinner and could get it back from restaurant within 15hours, very high prestige. 5 stars and high recommended to visit.

name: Marcel - Calmette
address: 115 Calmette Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Marcel is a French Gourmet Burger Joint, right in the center of Saigon. At Marcel, we like our burgers the French way : unique recipes with a creative twist, using only the finest ingredients to bring burgers to a gourmet level. Our juicy patties are a secret blend of 100% Australian grass-fed beef, cooked medium rare. Our very own soft and fresh buns are home-baked twice a day. All of our sides, sauces, salads and desserts are prepared in-house. Because at the the end, Marcel is all about making sure you enjoy the best gourmet experience.
example_reviews: If you find yourself in Ho Chi Min just wanting a good ole burger then you can’t miss Marcel - Calmette Burger. In fact, you just shouldn’t miss this place period. It’s just THAT GOOD. You can get a great smash burger or there are quite a number of options with a gourmet French twist. I love my burgers and this place is high up on my list of great burger restaurants. They also served great French fries and delicious desserts like creme brûlée, creamy cheesecake with raspberry sauce and brownies. The place itself is very cute and inviting. The hostess and cashier girls were so welcoming and helpful they made the whole experience that much more enjoyable. My family and I ate here twice and If I lived in Ho Chi Minh, I would be a regular here.

Came here after doing a quick Google search. Was craving a really good burger after eating Pho for almost a month. And this is a really good burger, the bread was one of the best I've tasted, although the meat could have been a little more seasoned. Fries were also very good and the homemade chili mayo that you get for free was the icing on the cake.

Marcel the price of the cake combo includes 1 side dish and 1 water and the cheapest is about 220k, the price of the cake is about 180 in the picture, I ate 2 people with soft, delicious meat cake, the crust is very soft. But since it seems that people order a lot with the order of which one is to be grilled, the wait is a bit long. If you go hungry, you will cry :))

name: Skewers
address: 9A Thai Van Lung Street, District 1 9A Thái Văn Lung, Q.1, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: Located near the Opera House, Caravelle and The Park Hyatt Hotel (5 minutes walk). Skewers has been open since July of 2000. The restaurant has 2 level, ground floor with 30+ seating, bar area and open kitchen. 1st floor with 12 tables, plus a cigar/smoking lounge. Skewers is open for lunch and dinner only. From 11:30 to 2pm and 6pm to 11pm. The kitchen last order is at 10:30pm. The restaurant is good for groups, wine tasting, lunch, special dinner, entertaining clients, romance, delivery and reservation.
example_reviews: This is a favourite restaurant in HCMC, conveniently located in District 1. Skewers serves excellent Mediterranean food-I had Greek sausages-in a pleasant ambiance with very courteous waiting staff. And it won't set you back huge amounts wither. Recommended.

Having had a few days of Vietnamese food, it was good to have a different type of meal. Had a dip with lots of different breads to share. Had a main course each,one of which is the seafood pasta under chefs recommended. All very delicious. Service was good and quick. Closes at 22.00 and we were advised 15 minutes early that it was time for last orders. Lots of places within a few minutes walking distance to have a drink afterwards

Love this place. This was my third time visiting. The wine is very cheap and I love the greek sausage and marinara sauce over the mashed potatoes and peas. I think I've ordered the same thing everytime I've visited. I'd try more of the menu but I just love the way they do that dish way too much. Great food.

name: Cocotte
address: 136/11 Le Thanh Ton, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Near Ben Thanh market, the heart of Ho Chi Minh, Discover Traditional Authentic French Cuisine for everyone, with great value, warm and friendly professional service. Indulge in our carefully selected wine selection. Cocotte is the address of French Bistro food and wines in Ho Chi Minh City.
example_reviews: Delicious lunch & good French wine for a nice price👌🏼 We went back for top dinner, the best we had in Vietnam in 3 weeks. French master chef level. Very friendly staff, who do their utmost to offer you great service. Strongly recommended. Great value for money. Must-do-in-Saigon

We had a great time with a really festive athmosphere that made us feel like in a Parisian bistro. The duck magret with pepper sauce, the oignon soup and the Bread were all delicious. The price was very reasonable with a bill of just 50€ for 3 of us including a bottle of delicious Bordeauw wine. We highly recomend and will go again!

Great French food at a reasonable price. Good selection of wine and the house wine, red or white, are as good as any in Saigon. The seafood stew is a must and ask for baguettes on the side to slurp up the sauce. Delicious

name: The Daun Restaurant
address: 48 Le Lai Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: With the favourites Vietnam/Malaysia/Singapore/Indonesia local dishes such as the Pho Bo, Bun Bo, Banh Xeo, Banh mi, Mee Nasi Goreng Seafood, Nasi Ayam Penyet and much more; you’ll definitely be spoilt for choices. The Malaysians & Singaporeans along with their other close counterparts such as Korean & Japanese would appreciate the pleasing sense to the taste and most likely they cannot forbear to close on the reminiscent experience. We also serve some European cuisines.
example_reviews: The only best halal food in HCMC. The quality of food served is excellent and delicious and prepared with care. The owner is a dedicated man who obviously cares greatly for his business, his food and above all his customers. Halal food a novelty in HCMC and therefore the prices are higher understandably. However, having eaten at other neighboring restaurants, none satisfied me with the quality of their food as Daun did. Other restaurants were noisy, cluttered and served seriously bland food. I think what has happened is that since halal food in HCMC is rare, other outlets don't care about quality as much since the Muslim customers will be forced to go to these restaurants. Daun, on the other hand, is still dedicated to serving great food. For that I am truly grateful. Don't take my word for it. Feel free to compare yourselves.

This halal & veg-friendly outlet is a delightful find💕 The menu is pretty extensive from Japanese to Western and South East Asian. We chose some healthy options - beef broth, French beans+egg, mushroom omelette & tumeric prawn (not on menu but a request that was graciously met). Mr Soffian, the owner, has a genuinely friendly personality with a passion for good service and great food. Wonderful hospitality! We got to try his egg coffee - a yummy concoction that seems like a dessert in a cup! If you’re after good friendly service and yummy food with something on the menu for a diverse group, you can’t go wrong with this eatery. Vert strongly recommended.

Located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Dau Restaurant offers a delightful blend of traditional Vietnamese cuisine and modern flair. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with a mix of rustic decor and contemporary touches that create a cozy yet stylish dining experience. The menu features a variety of dishes, but the standout for me was the pho, which was rich in flavor with perfectly tender beef. The fresh herbs and spices added a wonderful depth that truly showcased the essence of Vietnamese cooking. I also tried their summer rolls, which were light and refreshing, with a delightful peanut dipping sauce.

name: Ciao Bella District 1
address: 11 Dong Du Street District 1, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam Vietnam
description: New York Italian. Warm casual eatery
example_reviews: Best Italian Food in Ho Chi Minh City I visited 4 times. The quality and freshness is incredible and so is the service. Freshly grated pepper and Parmesan cheese, a free welcome sparkling and hands down best spaghetti puntanesca and Cesar salad. A must visit if you look for a real Italian Restauanrany and atmosphere

Ciao Bella in District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, offers a cozy Italian dining experience with warm service and delicious dishes. Highlights include complimentary prosecco and the signature Posh Carbonara prepared tableside. A great spot for a hearty Italian meal, though it can get busy during peak hours.

We needed a non Vietnam meal. Fabulous. Starts with glass of Prosecco, then they bing bread with 3 small samples of black olive puree, and dipping balsamic, and roasted garlic before you order. We had the beet salad(fabulous) spaghetti and meatballs, spinach and ricotta ravioli with house wines

name: Moo Beef Steak - 109 Ly Tu Trong
address: 109 Lý Tự Trọng Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Highly recommend. A nice treat for when in HCMC.
Great service, food, wine and setting.
A lot more than what you would price but it's really worth it as a one off treat when on holiday.
Highly recommended going on Mondays for the 50% off selected steaks to make it even more value for money.
example_reviews: Highly recommend. A nice treat for when in HCMC. Great service, food, wine and setting. A lot more than what you would price but it's really worth it as a one off treat when on holiday. Highly recommended going on Mondays for the 50% off selected steaks to make it even more value for money.

Every ingredient in our meal was of a high standard and prepared with great skilk. The steaks were succulent and cooked just to the right standard. The same could also be said for the fresh and delicious mussels as well as the mushrooms, asparagus, and chips. The wine menu was also excellent as was the care given to presentation and pouring. I also enjoyed the decor and the music created an intimate atmosphere that allowed our family to enjoy our time together without being intruded upon or intruding on others. My was an excellent waitress, ever solicitous of our enjoyment and comfort.

Monday night is 50% off night and just as well as prices on the menu don’t include VAT or Service charge. Monday night is quite busy. The restaurant has a great ambiance. You get a great pate aperitif with lovely hot bread rolls. The beef is really good quality and tasty. We had one strip loin (a bit of fat rind but really good) and a tenderloin (like fillet, no fat). Cooked medium rare perfect. The wines are very expensive so went for the beer option. The water was the most expensive in Vietnam 140,000 plus tax plus service! It came from France… no idea why! So it came out as the most expensive meal so far in Vietnam - in spite of the 50% discount. But great meal, good quality and service.

name: Bếp Cuốn Sài Gòn
address: 76 Võ Văn Tần, Phường Võ Thị Sáu, Quận 3, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: A Truely Vietnamese Experience!!! Bep Cuon Sai Gon is the 2nd branch of Bep Cuon Team. With the success of Bep Cuon Danang since Sep 2019, our team have decided to open the new restaurant in Ho Chi Minh City in Apr 2023 in hope of bringing the authentic Vietnamese cuisines to everyone living in Ho Chi Minh and travelers as well. Customers' satisfaction is our top priority, therefore, we always concentrate on food hygiene, cleanliness, food consistency and customer service. We do hope to have chance to welcome you all to our new Bep Cuon in Saigon.
example_reviews: We enjoyed shrimp and braised pork spring rolls and the Bep Cuon Combo 2. The food was fabulous and was more than enough for the two of us to share. The staff was so very friendly and showed us how to assemble our lunch with rice paper, lettuce, mint, basil, kimchi and the pork/shrimp pancake. The sauce (a mixture of the two provided...also demonstrated by one of our lovely servers) to dip in was so delicious I wanted to drink up the remains! I highly recommend this restaurant.

Went by by by chance and were really pleasantly surprised. Fantastic food. Many authentic Vietnamese dishes to choose from. We chose a combo. Pork, rice, boiled cabbage, fish soup and some other things that I do not know the name of. Not spicy, but oh what flavors. A little noisy environment if you want to be a little fussy, but very good speed of serving. Can really be recommended and here we will gladly come again.

Had a great experience at Bep Cuon Saigon! The crunchy banh xeo was absolutely delicious—light, crispy, and packed with flavor. The pork skewers were a highlight, too, perfectly seasoned and grilled just right. Fresh ingredients and great flavors make this spot worth a visit if you’re in Saigon and craving authentic, tasty bites.

name: Tandoor
address: 39A-39B Ngô Đức Kế, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Tandoor Indian Restaurants has been serving the best Indian food in Ho Chi Minh City since 1997. Our first restaurant is located on 39A Ngo Duc Ke street, at the intersection with the Nguyen Hue Walking street, and next to the famed Dong Khoi street. Witness the pinnacle of Indian cuisine through our experienced team composed of dedicated Indian veterans. Beyond our charming two venues in the heart of historical Saigon, we also offer Indian food delivery and catering. We persevere to serve delicious non-vegetarian, vegetarian, vegan, and halal Indian food to guests of all origins. At Tandoor Saigon, the freshest authentic spices are ground in-house and combined with quality local produce for the ultimate Indian dining experience.
example_reviews: We have been coming to Tandoor for two years now and it does not fail to please. The dishes are perfectly spiced to the level that you ask for, presentation is always excellent and the portions are spot on. Service from the staff is always excellent and you are served with a smile. The restaurant itself is very pleasing and clean. This is a very popular Indian restaurant for a reason and has a well deserved reputation for being managed to a very high standard.

I found this Indian really nice, good service, great food and the staff were really efficient and helpful. I will definitely be going again in the next 6 weeks. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys Indian food.

Found this by mistake we were looking for a steak restaurant but found they weren’t what we were looking for, so wondering around we’d seen the steak restaurant upstairs opposite but couldn’t find our way in (yes we’re slack sometimes) found this so decided on a curry instead with it being our last night, very pleasant restaurant and staff were lovely. Ordered a couple of beers to be going on with them our starters !! 1 starters each big mistake portion sizes are quite large, wife had the chicken tikka, I had onion pakora both were lovely and the touch of putting you first piece on your plate was quite nice, pakora were spicy and really nice best I’ve had for a while, tikka were lovely big pieces and so succulent. Then we had mains wife had keema mutta (probably spelt wrong) she said it was best she’s ever had just enough spice for her, I had chicken vindaloo, loads of chicken (loads of curry if I’m honest) not quite spicy enough for me usually have them a little hotter but very nice all the same. Portion sizes were quite large neither of us could finish our dishes ! I’d had a garlic naan wife had 2 chapatis not really nice, if we’re ever in HCMC again we shall definitely be back

name: Saigon Café - Seafood Buffet Restaurant
address: 88 Đông Du, Phường Bến Nghé, Quận 1 Sheraton Saigon Grand Opera Hotel, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: From the Opera House, walk along Dong Khoi street and you will easily recognize Saigon Café restaurant from its floor-to-ceiling glasses, luxury ambiance, modern finishing’s and vibrant energy. Situated on level 1 of the Sheraton Saigon Grand Opera Hotel overlooking Dong Khoi street, Saigon Café is one of the best buffet destinations in Saigon since 2003. Offering a vast selection of live cooking and interactive counters, each features an array of theater showcasing an array of hand-crafted dishes ranging from regional cuisines of Vietnam to Chinese, Japanese, Italian, French, Indian and more. From sunrise to sunset, our chefs, premium ingredients and excellent service quality will undoubtedly delight your taste buds for an unparalleled dining experience.
review_summary:
Saigon Café - Seafood Buffet Restaurant earns rave reviews for its exceptional service, with guests frequently commending the attentive and friendly staff. Nestled in the heart of the city, the restaurant's prime location and cozy atmosphere are popular among reviewers, creating a welcoming dining experience.

The buffet's selection of fresh, diverse seafood and international cuisine receives consistent praise for both variety and quality, contributing to the establishment's reputation for great value.
example_reviews: Visited this restaurant which is located within the Sheraton hotel 2wks ago to celebrate my sister’s birthday & we opted for the full experience with free flowing champagne- well worth the money. The restaurant had a wide diverse of dishes, all freshly prepared.- the lobster’s & fresh seafood were fantastic. The staff were wonderful & explained dishes that we ventured to try. They even surprised us with a birthday cake for my sister & the staff sang happy birthday to her- really nice gesture. There are other buffets in Saigon, but the review on the Saigon Cafe from YouTube- Tim Lee, attracted us the most & we were not disappointed. This is a wonderful experience not to be missed. Thank you Saigon Cafe for making our evening with you memorable- will definitely recommend this to everyone.

Wow, what an amazing service at Saigon Cafe. Hoàng and Huy were our waiters. They did a maverous job in their services, very attentive and hard working. Hoang recommended coconuts iced coffee. It’s the bomb! I love it.

Step into a vibrant culinary feast, where a wide range of flavours await you. Our sumptuous buffet brings together global delights - juicy grilled meats, fresh seafood, crisp salads and handmade cheeses to be enjoyed by all. Pasta made to order, fine sushi rolls and fresh-cut, quality meat chops are just as compelling. Don't forget to leave some room for dessert: everything from rich chocolate fountains to fine French pastries. Elegant and relaxing environment, perfect for family gatherings, business luncheons or weekend dinners. Fresh ingredients, attentive service and on-site cooking stations are carefully selected to ensure every visit is worth a taste. Whether you love home-cooked flavours or exotic treasures, our buffet feast will kick off an unforgettable taste bud journey for every diner. Dat & Quan & Huy they are the best!

name: P'ti Saigon
address: 52 Ngô Quang Huy Phường Thảo Điền, Quận 2, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Coming to P’ti Saigon, diners will be immersed in the culinary culture of Provence, the homeland of lavender in the south of France created by the hands of talented French chef Sakal Phoeung – who has been with the Accord Group and the Sofitel brand for more than 15 years, has had great success with the French restaurant Le Corto where it was honoured to welcome the French President François Hollande. The restaurant has designed a large, spacious kitchen with full equipment so that he and his students can prepare menus with culinary culture with stories. Beautiful, delicious and fine quality for health look forward to sending to customers who come to P’TI Saigon.
example_reviews: A French restaurant where a luxurious and cozy space creates a sense of comfort for guests. French cuisine is very delicate and beautiful, offering a rich and varied taste. However, the prices at this restaurant are a little higher compared to the quality of the food. However, Bang's service staff is very friendly and attentive and always ready to meet your needs.

We come here so many timea for brunch and every time we always ask brunch with freeflow package. We like it very much cauz we have 3hrs drink unlimited wine and prosecco...with tempting price. And staffs here all remember our names, ms Bang, ms Ha and ms Mo always always address me by name. Appriciated

I have used breakfast this morning and i very impressed about the food. French food is not my kind on but today is different. Thank to the waiter Bang, he recommended for me many delicious dishes when i say i don’t like french cuisine. His attitude very good

name: Quan Nem Restaurant
address: 15E Nguyen Thi Minh Khai street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description:
I went there by a recommendation with a friend who lived in HCMC as an expat. The place was packed during peaked hours so we made a booking in advance.

We ordered buncha with southern sauce and mixed of normal pork and bacon to try. Buncha was amazing, and gimmick of grilling pork and bacon added a nice touch to it. The vegetable side, typical in Vietnam, was huge and plenty. The sauce was yummy.

The crab roll is super big and tasty. It was served hot. I also tried their soda chan, soda with sugar and lime - was very refreshing.

We managed to get through this with limited English because the menu contained only buncha and rolls, not difficult to navigate. One of the best meal I have had in HCMC.
example_reviews: I went there by a recommendation with a friend who lived in HCMC as an expat. The place was packed during peaked hours so we made a booking in advance. We ordered buncha with southern sauce and mixed of normal pork and bacon to try. Buncha was amazing, and gimmick of grilling pork and bacon added a nice touch to it. The vegetable side, typical in Vietnam, was huge and plenty. The sauce was yummy. The crab roll is super big and tasty. It was served hot. I also tried their soda chan, soda with sugar and lime - was very refreshing. We managed to get through this with limited English because the menu contained only buncha and rolls, not difficult to navigate. One of the best meal I have had in HCMC.

The Bún Chả tastes good. It is served with soft white vermicelli, mint leaves and other greens, two different fish sauces, and grilled marinated pork patties and bacon strips. What I love most is the Nem Cua Bể, crispy rolls with pork and crab meat. These are served on a griddle and go well with the Bún Chả. The only downside of this place is the tiny size of the restaurant. It can get rather uncomfortable when it is full of patrons. But I would recommend anyone who visits Ho Chi Minh City and would love to taste good Vietnamese food.

This place is always packed with people, so don't be surprised if you have to wait a bit for a table. But the turnover is fast, so waiting time is rarely more than 15 minutes. The restaurant's specialty is fried crab spring rolls and that's pretty much all the restaurant serves other than grilled pork. The spring rolls are fantastic. I make a point to eat them at Quan Nem anytime I'm in Saigon (I went twice in three days during recent visit)!

name: Italiani's Pizza
address: 17 Han Thuyen, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: Italiani’s specializes in beautifully crafted individual wood fired pizzas and Italian-inspired dishes. We poured our hearts into creating a local Pizzeria that provides exceptional food, a welcoming environment for families and business professionals, and a fun date night spot for couples. We use the most flavorful tomatoes, cheeses and other fresh locally-sourced ingredients when possible to make our wood fired pizzas and Italian-inspired dishes. Our pizza dough is also made with “secret” ingredients that are hand worked and tossed to ensure that our pizzas have a deliciously thin crispy crust, with a chewy center, topped with the freshest ingredients. They are then fired to perfection in our authentic wood fired oven to seal in flavor and transform our menu items into fine crafted masterpieces. Our appetizers, salads, homemade gelato, and local craft beers are just a few more reasons to enjoy a meal at Italiani’s Homemade Pizza.
review_summary:
Italiani's Pizza comes highly recommended by many guests who extol the virtues of its friendly and attentive staff. While the atmosphere receives mixed reviews—some patrons describe it as cozy, others find it lacking—the authentic, wood-fired pizzas consistently earn rave reviews for their flavorful crusts and varied toppings.

Although a few visitors mention that prices can be steep, the majority agree that the delicious offerings provide good value.
example_reviews: Italiani's Pizza Han Thuyen - The children fancied pizza after all the pho they had eaten. From the moment we entered, the customer service was impeccable. Tracy the staff went above and beyond not just with the service but also when we asked about where to get mangosteen she researched where we could get some as the season for this fruit was over. After the children devoured the pizza we had to order another as it was so delicious! After leaving to go to the recommended spot for mangosteen, we realised we forgot our backpack and the manager/owner went out of his way to drop the bag to us! How kind! The staff are so lovely here and food is of high quality so if you ever fancy a pizza definitely would recommend this establishment! This will be somewhere we will definitely return to eat!

We ordered salad, pasta, and pizza, and everything tasted amazing. Highly recommend the pesto pasta with chicken. Our server Rambo was always attentive and help us through out our ordering with excellent recommendations! He even suggested some nice places to visit during the night.

Accommodating staff and tasty pizza. be mindful it’s a little pricier than the usual Vietnamese dinner prices. We paid 1,400000 VND for 4 pizzas and drinks for 3 adults and 3 kids. Air conditioning is worked well.

name: Rice Field
address: 75 - 77 Ho Tung Mau Level 2, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Located on 1 of the busiest streets in Saigon, Rice Field is like a gem brings you a touch of VN countryside by the authentic Vietnamese food and decoration
example_reviews: Wandering around bustling Ho Chi Minh City in search of a Vietnamese restaurant for dinner, we were intrigued by Rice Field , which is located right at the foot of the Bitexo Financial Tower on the opposite side , hard not to find! Original location all in wood with original Vietnamese details , we had dinner on the ground floor , very young waiters in traditional clothes quick and gentle , menu 'extensive at inline prices being recommended on the Michelin Guide . We ordered more dishes, almost all vegetarian, fantastic fried rolls, other fresh rolls of mixed vegetables, sautéed noodles with tofu and vegetables and fried calamari with vegetables, all great, well presented and hearty dishes, sauces and chilli served separately, however they ask for the degree of spiciness you want. Great idea to bring lettuce to wrap the fried rolls and not get your hands dirty! Really one of the best restaurants we stayed in our three weeks in Vietnam. Recommended! Only note, I would recommend more care in cleaning tables and in the bathroom.

Delicious, lots of it. Good service. Central location but reasonable price with mid-range income, 2 people eat about 500k to be full. You should replace the chopsticks with new ones, the current chopsticks are moldy, reducing the customer experience

I had the pleasure of dining at this restaurant and I must say it was a truly exceptional dining experience. From the beginning, the welcoming and relaxing atmosphere made me feel at ease straight away. The dish that struck my palate the most was the fried calamari, crunchy and tasty, with a touch of freshness that made every bite a real pleasure. The fried garlic rice was equally delicious, packed with flavor and perfectly prepared. I can't help but mention the Michelin rice cake, which was truly a pleasant surprise: soft and tasty, demonstrating the chef's culinary skill. The service was impeccable, with friendly staff attentive to our needs. The background music helped create a pleasant atmosphere, without ever being intrusive. I highly recommend this restaurant to all lovers of good food and an authentic dining experience. If you're looking for delicious flavors and a welcoming environment, you can't go wrong with this place! I will definitely be back to try other delicacies on the menu. Five stars deserved!

name: Pizza 4P's Le Thanh Ton
address: 8/15, Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn Phường Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: An Earth to People restaurant on a mission to make the world smile for peace, one pizza at a time. Earth to People is our commitment to serve safe and fresh foods directly from Mother Earth to you. Located in Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, Danang, Haiphong and Nha Trang.
example_reviews: We checked the menu online and picked a location close to our hotel, and cancelled our original choice of a rooftop restaurant or bar, for our last night in Vietnam. The outlet we visited was packed to the gills and we then moved to this one. Despite being very very crowded with a one hour waiting, the staff at the earlier outlet were exceptionally helpful and courteous. Once we got to our new location, from the very beginning the staff was helpful in accommodating our booking change from 2 guests to 4 and gave us a table as soon as they could and tried to ensure we got seats whilst waiting. Every drink / dish we ordered turned out to be exceptional. The servers were very perceptive and understood our requirements and ensured that they clarified about allergens, and to the extent of limitations we may have about other ingredients. It shows the training and culture of the Brand. They also took pains to clarify that some dishes would not suit us or apologise for being sold out! The (very common) Mojito, or the Sangrias or even the Whey cider were exceptional to say the least. The cheese platters with the toasted breads, the pizza, the desserts (esp the terrine) were fantastic Personally, I found it refreshing and surprising that a chain with outlets across countries and cities, was able to rise above mass production and yet retain flavour, presentation as also service. Highly recommend this to all visitors to Vietnam (and elsewhere), and especially to vegetarians / vegans for the choices.

This establishment offers exceptional value for your money, providing not only affordable prices but also delivering high-quality and satisfying meals. The service is not only efficient but also friendly, creating a welcoming atmosphere that enhances the overall dining experience. With such a positive experience, I can confidently say that I will eagerly return to enjoy the delicious food and hospitality once again.

PIZZA 4P’S, a real hidden gem located in district 1 in ‘mini Japan town’. We were completely blown away by the fresh ingredients that you could clearly taste/sense were fresh! Organic, sustainable, local + homemade cheese, reasonable prices for the quality and sweet/proffesional staff, just a very good experience. Don’t be fooled by the name, there’s much more than just pizza on the menu.

name: Pasteur Street Craft Beer - Original Taproom
address: 144/3 Pasteur, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Our Original Taproom! This is where it all started in 2015. This small and cozy Taproom is known by many and was one of the first places where you could get your craft beer in Saigon. We have expanded with more seats and a rooftop further down the alley on the right side which opens daily 11am – 12am,
review_summary:
The Pasteur Street Craft Beer - Original Taproom garners praise for its inviting atmosphere and the accompaniment of good music, as noted by patrons who appreciate the venue's cool vibe. Guests have called out the Western-style food options for their tastiness and generous portions, emphasizing the overall delicious and diverse menu offerings. While the craft beers are described as refreshing, they are also sometimes considered to be on the pricier side.

However, the overall value is regarded as favorable due to the food's affordability. The establishment's service earns rave reviews for the staff's remarkable friendliness and attentiveness, contributing to a truly welcoming experience.
example_reviews: Great food at a good price was very happy with what we received. Wife had the Crab omelet with garlic fried rice and I had the 2 sausages with onion rings and oyster mushrooms as a side. 10/10 reminded me of good pub food from home.

I really enjoyed this place. I am a lightweight and I am always looking for a beer with less alcohol and have the ability to order in a small glass instead of a pint or something huge and this place hit all of the dots. It also had probably the best tasting, very low alcohol beer I have ever had - chanh muoi ale (salted lime). Thinking about this place too much and will go back when I am in Saigon again! :)

I did not expect to find ‘real’ craft beer in Vietnam. I am so pleasantly surprised. I got a flight; I had the Irish Stout, Jasmine Red, Session IPA, Pomello IPA, Double Jasmine IPA, and the special Stout (I forget the exact name; it’s an extra charge) It was super delicious! Cherry and chocolate notes. Yum! I had the Pasteur Street hamburger which comes with fries. It was delicious. My wife had the Omelette with crab and rice and it was delicious as well. It was also delicious. We had the fried ground duck with rice crackers and the onion rings for an appetizer. I recommend both. The service was impeccabile. Our waiter was very friendly and helped us order food. Everything is in English so there was no problem ordering. My wife does not like spicy foods, so the waiter made sure nothing was spicy, and brought me some Tabasco to spice up my food. I HIGHLY recommend eating here if you’re in the area. There is a bit of variety in the menu, so you’re not limited to one or two choices. Again, if you like craft beer definitely stop by here … and take a flight!

name: Hoang's Kitchen - Vietnamese Cuisine & Vegan Food
address: 45 Thủ Khoa Huân Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Hoang’s Kitchen, where the rich flavors of Vietnamese cuisine blend seamlessly with the timeless beauty of Southeast Asian-inspired architecture. Located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, our restaurant is a haven for both locals and international visitors seeking an authentic dining experience. Welcome to Hoang’s Kitchen, where the rich flavors of Vietnamese cuisine blend seamlessly with the timeless beauty of Southeast Asian-inspired architecture.
example_reviews: Vivi was amazing and looked after us so well! We stopped in for lunch and had the vegan beef stir-fry and the vegan pho and they were absolutely delicious and very well priced. We had a cold beer too. Thank you so much Vivi for all of your help and the great food recommendations!

Very tasty food: we had a couple of salads for lunch – banana flour and shrimp with roasted peanuts and a similar salad with green mangoes, accompanied by fruit juices (passion and mango) plus to finish Vietnamese iced coffee (coconut) and ginger tea. Service was speedy. Our server Ryan was so helpful, responsive and friendly. His English is excellent. Background music is pop, while we were there Vietnamese in a western style but we were told that sometimes it is western music and musicians.

I stumbled upon Hoang’s Kitchen and it turned out to be one of my favorite food spots in the city! I ordered the fresh rolls and the incredibly soft grilled pork with quail eggs — both recommended by Bear, one of the friendliest and most helpful staff I’ve met on my trip. The flavors were bold, fresh, and perfectly balanced. The grilled pork was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and paired with the quail eggs, it hit all the right notes. Bear really went above and beyond to make sure I had the best experience — from helping with the order to making great suggestions. It’s the kind of place that feels warm, local, and authentic. Highly recommend if you’re in Saigon and craving something genuinely good and comforting!

name: Vo Roof
address: 113 Ton That Dam Street Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Vo Roof - Modern Vietnamese Kitchen & Bar! We take great pride in offering you a delightful dining experience with our healthy Vietnamese cuisine. Our dishes are cooked in a modern Vietnamese kitchen, using family recipes that have been passed down for three generations. Our food is free from MSG, and instead, focus on using fresh ingredients and moderate seasoning to bring forth the authentic flavors of Vietnam. At Vo Roof, our commitment to providing a memorable dining experience goes beyond just the food. We also feature a cozy and chilling tropical-inspired ambiance, where you can relax and unwind with your loved ones. To complement your dining experience, we offer a selection of classic cocktails prepared with utmost care and artistry. Visit us and embark on a culinary journey that combines tradition and innovation, all wrapped up in a warm and inviting atmosphere.
example_reviews: First time in Ho Chi Minh and wanted somewhere relaxed to eat. Vo Roof is an absolute must if you want some genuinely tasty food (chicken skewers and dry noodle bowls are awesome), and really good prices. Staff are lovely and super friendly, young, fun and helpful. Please do visit as sure you will be delighted. Oh, and book as only small and reserved signs on table, use Facebook.

I had lunch with friends in this restaurant. Recommendation if you want to dine here to book or arrive early because it is always very full and in fact we the evening of the day before we could not sit down. The next day we ate at the counter and had a great time: dishes with good tastes (meat sandwich, fried chicken with vegetables...) and low prices in the average Saigon prices. Super recommended!

From start to finish, Vo Roof, exceeded all expectations, and provided a superlative dining experience in a relaxed and inviting environment. From the moment we entered, the friendly and attentive staff made us feel incredibly welcome. Upon being seated we were served a refreshing starter of cool juice along with wet towelettes to freshen up and clear the dust from our journey through the busy Saigon streets. The menu was extensive and the prices were surprisingly low compared to other restaurants in District 1. Our dishes were served quickly and the food was excellent. My wife and I were discussing whether we could possibly make room for a light dessert when to our delighted surprise our waiter appeared with two small dishes of delicious cubed fruit which was provided free of charge as if they had read our minds. A perfect finish to a wonderful evening out. We will absolutely be returning to enjoy more of the wonderful food, superb, friendly service, and joyful atmosphere provided. Do yourself a favour and track down this hidden gem on your next visit to Saigon.

name: La Fiesta
address: 128 Ly Tu Trong Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Hola Amigos! This is OUR Tex-Mexican Restaurant in HCMC, Vietnam. I'm (Scott) from Maine, USA & my wife and better half (Duc) is from here in Saigon. What we are trying to do here at La Fiesta is to make some tasty and fairly authentic Tex-Mexican food, served with a smile in a welcoming setting. We make all of our sauces and tortillas onsite, and also use Saigon Tacos locally made Corn Tortillas & Salsa Verde. We take great pride in our work, and strive to do our best to pay attention to detail every single day. It's the little things that count, and that gets lost sometimes. We will all work hard every day to stay on top of our game, and keep you wanting to come back to La Fiesta. Serving tasty Tex-Mex food and drink in the heart of Saigon.
example_reviews: The food is AMAZING. So many choices of Mexican, western, salads and different sides. The portions they give you are very generous and the staff are so lovely. One of the best restaurants we’ve been to in vietnam. They also give you some free crisps/dips at the start of your meal and a free shot at the end of the meal!

The first time I went to La Fiesta I didn't really do the food justice as I was on a diet and so only ate the chicken salad. But the salad was refreshing and the dressing was enjoyable. The chicken was very more-ish too. And the frozen jalapeno Margarita was one of the best, most enjoyable Margaritas tasted anywhere. The next two times I had a delivery of chili con carne which came with french fries, so I made my own basmati rice to go with the chili as rice is my preference and also enjoyed the shoestring fries. I had a side of salad too which was just as fresh and tasty as I remembered. The chili con carne was too much on the mild side for me, although still a delicious flavour, but a couple of sliced red chilis added to the chili soon remedied that and brought it up to the level of spiciness I'm used to. The whole experience was very satisfying and I.m now looking forward to trying many of the other dishes at La Fiesta as well.

I had burrito plate which included taco salad that was tasty and fresh, tofu burrito which was tasty and two sides including refried beans that were really good, rice that was bland, and for dessert a brownie that was very fresh. I had fresh watermelon juice and it tasted like it was just made. It was 2pm and there were 2 other tables, and lots of Grab delivery guys picking up. Servers are so nice and attentive.

name: Tonkin Coffee
address: 91 Ly Tu Trong Follow the red slit and go upstairs to the 2nd floor, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Ho Chi Minh's coffee haven. Tonkin Specialty Coffee: Rich Vietnamese brews, colonial charm & garden escapes. Immerse your senses. Tonkin Specialty Coffee: 91 Ly Tu Trong, Ben Thanh ward, District 1 https://maps.app.goo.gl/fEY7STPwVrZCwkVg8 Tonkin Garden: 135/50 Tran Hung Dao, Cau Ong Lanh ward, District 1 https://maps.app.goo.gl/aQG9XsYygEoQ5CxdA
example_reviews: This is a lovely relaxed coffee shop that sits above the hustle and bustle of district 1. The cafe is very atmospheric with comfortable indoor seating or section of bar seating on the balcony. Of the coffee options there were clear vegan options (oat milk/coconut). While obviously a little more expensive than more local places, this is still reasonably priced at less than £2 for a coconut coffee with coconut flakes and a complimentary cold tea on arrival. The cafe is above a restaurant, there is a sign for it, and to the left of the sign is a doorway leading to a corridor, at the end of this corridor you go up the steps to level 2. The steps are a decent size and have railing so suitable for anyone who can climb stairs mobility wise.

In April 2024 I visited Vietnam with my son. While we were there, like so many other tourists and locals alike, we both fell in love with Vietnamese coffee and sought out various coffee shops across the country to try their version of the national drink. Tonkin Coffee in HCMC offered some of the absolute best coffee we had during our 3-week stay in Vietnam. We tried out their milk and egg coffees – both were delicious, so much so that we ordered a second coffee while we were there. As we were also hungry when we got to the coffee shop, we had some of their pastries and banh mi. Both were excellent! I should also mention the outstanding friendly service at the café as well. This literal hole in the wall café is located down a long alley hallway and up a flight of stairs, but it is well worth seeking out. I highly recommend this wonderful little coffee shop!

A true hidden gem in Saigon! We nearly walked past it as the entrance is just a doorway, but we’re glad we found it! We both had the Tonkin version of a Vietnamese coffee (mine was iced, my husband went for hot). We also had a custard-filled croissant each which were absolutely lovely! The atmosphere was calm and the staff lovely. Get yourself in!
